column3:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #18988 (RFC: Introducing AltNet, a pluggable framework for alternative transports by ariard)
* #18987 (RFC: Introducing W
Concept ACK: very welcome from a fuzzing perspective!\n\nI know that I am repeating myself but nevertheless: thanks for doing these coupling cleanups :)
Rebased due to conflict in tests
Concept ACK! Reviewing in detail now.

> Code review ACK 9f0a6f3. Just rebased again and simplified double ::g_ prefixes\n\nThe commit you reviewed is not signed by me, nor does it include my proof of work. I declare this review invalid.

> > Code review ACK [9f0a6f3](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/9f0a6f36b5ccf08e054af63d242c8b98344676b0). Just rebased again and simplified double ::g_ prefixes
> 
> The commit you reviewed is not signed by me, nor does it include my proof of work. I declare this review invalid.

Maybe I just liked Ariard's commit so much I just wanted to comment about it on your PR?
The rebases are trivial and I don't mind them, but letting this sit in the rebase-ping-pong doesn't make the changes any better over time. Is there anything left to be done here before merge?

> Is there anything left to be done here before merge?

Not that I can think of, this looks good to me

In commit "node: Add chainman alias for g_chainman" (faad46a5358a12691c80c027caf666e91ca85a1e)\n\nHere and in test setup could consider replacing double redundant `::g_` prefix with just `g_`. If a variable name already begins with `g_` then `::` doesn't tell you much and gets in the way of creating namespaces

In commit "validation: Mark g_chainman DEPRECATED" (fa24ea2e67d9812a7b57f9820996a8695a8fef37)\n\nCould enforce this by deleting extern declaration from validation.h, and just declaring it an extern variable right where it's used in init.cpp.
I might remove it in a later pull altogether, so I opted for the smallest diff for now
Good point. Will address on the next force push or the follow-up pull, whichever comes earlier.
